alert.note: Alert for Pemiscot (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 08 at 11:36AM CST until March 19 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Mississippi...Arkansas...Tennessee...Missouri... Mississippi River at Tunica Mhoon Landing Mississippi River Above Tiptonville Mississippi River at Caruthersville For the Lower Mississippi River...including Tiptonville, Caruthersville, Osceola, Memphis, Tunica Mhoon Landing, Helena... Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SATURDAY, MARCH 19... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mississippi River at Caruthersville. * WHEN...Until Saturday, March 19. * IMPACTS...At 35.0 feet, Grounds of the riverboat factory north of Caruthersville, Missouri are flooding. Park on riverbank at Caruthersville is beginning to go under water. In Tennessee, Barr Road is under two feet of water in places and evacuations are very difficult. Most unprotected farm land near the river and portions of Highway 104 in western Dyer County are impacted. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 AM CST Tuesday the stage was 34.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:00 AM CST Tuesday was 34.8 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 35.0 feet Thursday morning. It will then fall to 34.9 feet and begin rising again Thursday morning. It will rise to 35.0 feet Thursday evening. It will then fall below flood stage Friday, March 18. - Flood stage is 32.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Additional information is available at weather.gov/memphis. The next statement will be issued as conditions warrant.
